   "body_snippet": "<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->\r\nI would like to have the tool/menu bars stay where I put them (e.g. the bottom)  The File menu bar never stays at the bottom,  It always reverts back to the top of the window.  I need to unlock the toolbar and manually move to the bottom every time.\r\n\r\n## Expected Behavior\r\n<!--- If you're describing a bug, tell us what should happen -->\r\n<!--- If you're suggesting a change/improvement, tell us how it should work -->\r\nBe able t...",

+    {
+      "seq": 1,
+      "date": "2026-02-18",
+      "type": "triaged",
+      "description": "The Main Menu toolbar position is not persisted in user settings, unlike other toolbars. This causes the menu to reset to the top position on every application restart, preventing users from customizing their workspace layout permanently."
+    }
+  ],
   "comments": [
     {
       "id": "MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDQ3NzMyMjU0Mw==",
@@ -50,5 +57,5 @@

   "last_synced": "2026-02-15T09:52:50Z",
-  "notes": ""
+  "notes": "AI triage (gemini): The Main Menu toolbar position is not persisted in user settings, unlike other toolbars. This causes the menu to reset to the top position on every application restart, preventing users from customizing their workspace layout permanently.\nApproach: Add MainMenuLocation and MainMenuParentDock properties to Settings. Update SettingsSaver.SaveSettings to persist the msMain position and SettingsLoader.LoadSettings (AddMainMenuPanel) to restore it, defaulting to 'Top' if not set."
 }
